intro: Scleria pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf spikerush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, spike-like clusters of white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight sheen, and it is often found in dense colonies. Scleria pygmaea is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
